result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary L Thayer

records.addlTxt:
Signature bond is set in the amount of $250 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- DCPS to test weekly.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Defendant in court with Attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case 21CT337 refiled as 22CF1445. Bond posted in 21CT337 to be applied to cc in 22CF1445. Jt: plea ct 1. 24 mo probation, $600, cc, assessment, 36 rev/IID, 60 d DCJ cs to 21CT338. Argument. No statement by DE. Court does not accept agreement and sets case for sentencing. Parties recess for Attorney Johnen to speak with DE. Parties reconvene and Attorney Johnen reports that DE requests to withdraw the pleas. Court withdraws pleas and puts case on trial calendar.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Sasa Johnen.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

Defendant in court with Attorney .  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
